ServerName.Desc: Server name. Fill in any name you like

ServerDescription.Desc: Server description. Fill in any server description you like

ServerWebsiteURL.Desc: Server website address. Will be displayed as a clickable link in the server browser

ServerPassword.Desc: Server password. The password that players use to enter the game server

ServerLoginConfirmationText.Desc: Server login confirmation text. If this option is set, users will see this message when joining the server and must confirm it before continuing. For more complex changes to this window, change the serverjoinrulesdialog window in XUi

Region.Desc: The region where the server is located. Possible values ​​are: Asia, NorthAmericaEast, NorthAmericaWest, CentralAmerica, SouthAmerica, Europe, Russia, MiddleEast, Africa, Oceania

Language.Desc: The primary language of players on the server. Use the English name of any language players wish to search for. Possible values ​​are: english, german, spanish, french, italian, japanese, koreana, polish, brazilian, russian, turkish, schinese, tchinese

ServerPort.Desc: The port the server program is listening on. If you want computers on the same LAN to see it as a LAN server, keep this in the range 26900 to 26905 or 27015 to 27020

ServerVisibility.Desc: Visibility of the server. 2 = public, 1 = visible only to friends, 0 = unlisted. Since you are never friends with the dedicated server, setting this to 1 will only work if the first player connects manually by IP

ServerDisabledNetworkProtocols.Desc: Networking protocols disabled by the server. Comma separated, possible values ​​LiteNetLib, SteamNetworking. Dedicated servers should disable SteamNetworking if there is no NAT router between the user and the server, or port forwarding is setup correctly

ServerMaxWorldTransferSpeedKiBs.Desc: Server maximum world transfer speed. Maximum speed (in kiB/s) for world transfers on first connection if the client does not have a world yet. Maximum value is about 1300 kiB/s, even if you set it higher

ServerMaxPlayerCount.Desc: Maximum number of players on the server. Maximum number of players allowed online at once

ServerReservedSlots.Desc: Server reserved slots. Beyond the maximum number of players, many slots can only be used by players with a certain permission level.

ServerReservedSlotsPermission.Desc: Server reserved slots permission. The permission level required to use the above reserved slots

ServerAdminSlots.Desc: Server admin slots. Even if the server has reached the maximum number of players, there are still so many admins who can join

ServerAdminSlotsPermission.Desc: Server admin permission slots. The permission level required to use the above admin slots

WebDashboardUrl.Desc: External URL for the web dashboard. (If not using only the public IP of the server, e.g. the web dashboard is behind a reverse proxy). Needs to be a full URL, e.g. https://domainOfReverseProxy.tld:1234/. Can be left blank if using the public IP and dashboard port directly.

EnableMapRendering.Desc: Enable map rendering. Enable/disable rendering of maps as tile images when browsing maps. For example, the web dashboard can use this to display map views.

TelnetEnabled.Desc: Whether the Telnet service is enabled. Enable or disable Telnet service <true,false>

TelnetPassword.Desc: Telnet access password. If no password is set, the server will only listen to the local loopback interface

TelnetFailedLoginLimit.Desc: Telnet login failure limit. After a remote client enters an incorrect password multiple times, the client will be blocked from connecting to the Telnet interface

TelnetFailedLoginsBlocktime.Desc: Login failure lock time. After exceeding the login failure limit, how long will the block last (in seconds)

TerminalWindowEnabled.Desc: Terminal window enabled. Show terminal window for log output/command input (Windows only)

AdminFileName.Desc: Server admin file name. Path relative to SaveGameFolder

UserDataFolder.Desc: User data folder. Use this to override where the server stores all generated data, including RWG generated worlds. Don't forget to uncomment

SaveGameFolder.Desc: Save game folder. Only used to override game save path. Don't forget to uncomment

EACEnabled.Desc: Whether EAC anti-cheat is enabled. Whether to enable anti-cheat function (need to be turned off for cracked and Chinese servers)

IgnoreEOSSanctions.Desc: Ignore EOS sanctions. Ignore EOS sanctions when allowing players to join

HideCommandExecutionLog.Desc: Hide command execution log. 0 = Show everything, 1 = Hide only from Telnet/Control Panel, 2 = Hide also from remote game clients, 3 = Hide everything

MaxUncoveredMapChunksPerPlayer.Desc: The area that each player can explore on the game map. Therefore, the maximum map file size per player is limited to (x * 512 bytes) and the coverage area is (x * 256 square meters). The default value of 131072 means that a maximum of 32 square kilometers of map can be uncovered at any time

PersistentPlayerProfiles.Desc: Whether the player profile can be changed. If disabled, players can join with any selected profile. If true, they will join using the config file they last joined with

MaxChunkAge.Desc: Number of days in game that a chunk will be reset to its original state after it has been visited if it has not been revisited or protected (e.g. by having a territory stone or sleeping bag nearby)

SaveDataLimit.Desc: Save data limit. Maximum disk space allowed per saved game, in MB. When this limit is reached, saved game chunks may be forcibly reset to their original state to free up space. Negative values ​​disable the limit

GameWorld.Desc: Game world map. Navezgane[Fixed Map], RWG[Random Map] (see 'World Seed' and 'World Size' options below) or any existing world name in the 'Worlds' folder (e.g. 'Navezgane', 'PREGEN01'...)

WorldGenSeed.Desc: World Seed. If RWG, this is the seed to generate a new world. If a world with the same name already exists, it will be loaded directly

WorldGenSize.Desc: World Generated Size. If RWG, controls the width and height of the created world. Officially supported sizes are between 6144 and 10240 and must be multiples of 2048, e.g. 6144, 8192, 10240

GameName.Desc: GameName. Whatever you want your game to be called, this will affect the name of the saved game and the seed used when placing decorations (trees, etc.) in the world. If creating an RWG world, it does not control the general layout of the world

GameDifficulty.Desc: GameDifficulty. Difficulty from 0 to 5, 0 is easiest and 5 is hardest

BlockDamagePlayer.Desc: Player Block Damage. Damage dealt to blocks by the player (percentage, expressed as an integer)

BlockDamageAI.Desc: AI Block Damage. Damage dealt to blocks by the AI ​​(percentage, expressed as an integer) (integer)

BlockDamageAIBM.Desc: AI Block Damage during Blood Moon. Damage caused to blocks by AI during Blood Moon (percentage, expressed as integer)

XPMultiplier.Desc: XP Gain Multiplier. XP Gain Multiplier for Players (percentage, expressed as integer)

PlayerSafeZoneLevel.Desc: Novice Player SafeZone Level. If the player's level is less than or equal to this level, he will create a safe zone (no enemies) when spawning. If the player is below this level, zombies will no longer spawn around him

PlayerSafeZoneHours.Desc: Safe Zone Duration. The effective time of the player's safe zone (in game hours)

BuildCreate.Desc: Creative mode. Switches cheat mode on and off

DayNightLength.Desc: Real time of a day in the game (in minutes). Indicates how many minutes of real time is equivalent to a day in the game

DayLightLength.Desc: Daylight Length in the game. Indicates how many hours of daylight there are in a day (default 18 hours)

DeathPenalty.Desc: Penalty after death. 0 = None. 1 = Default: Classic XP penalty. 2 = Injured: You will keep most of your debuffs. Respawn with a 50% food and water ratio. 3 = Permadeath: Your character will be completely reset. You will be reborn in a saved game)

DropOnDeath.Desc: Death drop. 0 = None, 1 = All, 2 = Toolbelt Only, 3 = Backpack Only, 4 = Delete All

DropOnQuit.Desc: Logout drop. 0 = None, 1 = All, 2 = Toolbelt Only, 3 = Backpack Only

BedrollDeadZoneSize.Desc: The size of the BedrollDeadZone (i.e. a box radius with each side twice the length of the given value) where zombies will not spawn. Any cleared sleeper zones that touch the BedrollDeadZone will not spawn again after clearing

BedrollExpiryTime.Desc: Bedroll expiration time. The number of real-world days a sleeping bag will remain active after the owner was last online

MaxSpawnedZombies.Desc: Maximum number of spawned zombies. This setting covers the entire map, there can only be so many zombies on the entire map at once. Changing this setting can have a huge impact on performance

MaxSpawnedAnimals.Desc: Maximum number of spawned zombies. If you have a large number of players on your server, you can increase this limit to add more wildlife. Animals do not consume a lot of CPU like zombies. Note: This will not cause arbitrarily more animals to spawn: the biome spawning system will only spawn a certain number of animals in a given area, but if you have a large and spread out player base you may run into the limit, so you can increase it

ServerMaxAllowedViewDistance.Desc: Maximum view distance allowed for clients (6 - 12). Has a significant impact on memory usage and performance

MaxQueuedMeshLayers.Desc: The maximum number of Chunk mesh layers that can be queued during mesh generation. Reducing this value will increase memory usage, but may increase Chunk generation time

ZombieFeralSense.Desc: Zombie Feral Sense. 0-3 (off, day, night, all)

ZombieMove.Desc: Zombie move. 0-4 (walk, jog, run, sprint, nightmare)

ZombieMoveNight.Desc: Zombie night move. 0-4 (walk, jog, run, sprint, nightmare)

ZombieFeralMove.Desc: Zombie Feral Move. 0-4 (Walk, Jog, Run, Sprint, Nightmare)

ZombieBMMove.Desc: Zombie BM Move. 0-4 (Walk, Jog, Run, Sprint, Nightmare)

BloodMoonFrequency.Desc: Blood Moon Frequency. How often (in days) a Blood Moon appears. Setting this to 0 means no Blood Moon

BloodMoonRange.Desc: Blood Moon Range. The actual Blood Moon day can deviate from the above setting by a random number of days. When this value is set to 0, the Blood Moon will appear on time every N days specified in the Blood Moon Frequency

BloodMoonWarning.Desc: Blood Moon Warning. The number of hours after the red day of the Blood Moon day begins. When this is set to -1, Red will never be displayed.

BloodMoonEnemyCount.Desc: Blood Moon Enemy Count. This is the number of zombies that can be alive (spawned at the same time) at any time for each player in a Blood Moon Zombie Group, but in multiplayer, MaxSpawnedZombies overrides this. Also note that the game stage sets the maximum number of zombies per side. Low game stage values ​​will result in zombie counts lower than the Blood Moon Enemy Count setting. Changing this setting can have a huge impact on performance.

LootRespawnDays.Desc: Search Item Refresh Days. How many days it takes to refresh the searchable item resources

AirDropFrequency.Desc: Airdrop frequency. Indicates how many game hours an airdrop is made, 0 = never

AirDropMarker.Desc: Airdrop display. Sets whether to add a marker on the map/compass for airdrops

PartySharedKillRange.Desc: Party shared kill range. The distance required to get party shared kill rewards and mission party kill target rewards

PlayerKillingMode.Desc: Player killing settings (0 = no killing, 1 = only damage allies, 2 = only damage strangers, 3 = damage everyone)

LandClaimCount.Desc: Number of LandClaim. The maximum number of LandClaimSize allowed per player

LandClaimSize.Desc: LandClaimSize protection range. Unit is block

LandClaimDeadZone.Desc: LandClaimSize protection range. The distance between LandClaimSizes. LandClaimSizes must be greater than this distance to be set (unless you are friends with the other party)

LandClaimExpiryTime.Desc: Number of days for LandClaim protection when the player is offline. Number of days (in real time) that LandClaimSizes are valid after the player is offline

LandClaimDecayMode.Desc: LandClaimSize protection decay mode. Controls the decay mode of the offline player's land range. 0 = Slow (Linear), 1 = Fast (Exponential), 2 = None (Full protection until expiration)

LandClaimOnlineDurabilityModifier.Desc: The protection multiplier of the LandStone when the player is online. Indicates the hardness multiplier of the LandStone when the player is online, 0 means invincibility, default 4 times

LandClaimOfflineDurabilityModifier.Desc: The protection multiplier of the LandStone when the player is offline. Indicates the hardness multiplier of the LandStone when the player is offline, 0 means invincibility, default 4 times

LandClaimOfflineDelay.Desc: The number of minutes after the player quits the game for the LandStone hardness to change from online to offline. Default is 0

DynamicMeshEnabled.Desc: Whether to enable the dynamic mesh system

DynamicMeshLandClaimOnly.Desc: Whether the dynamic mesh system is only valid in the player LCB area

DynamicMeshMaxItemCache.Desc: Dynamic mesh maximum item cache. How many projects can be processed simultaneously, the higher the value, the more RAM is used

TwitchServerPermission.Desc: Permission level required to use twitch integration on the server

TwitchBloodMoonAllowed.Desc: Whether to allow Twitch Blood Moon. If the server allows Twitch operations during a Blood Moon, additional zombies may spawn during the Blood Moon, causing server lag

QuestProgressionDailyLimit.Desc: Daily quest progress limit. Limits the number of quests a player can complete each day to help increase their quest level. Quests above the limit can still be completed to receive rewards
